snippet: The net loss for the quarter was up from $740 million in the same period last year, despite increases in mail prices and growth in shipping services.
abstract: Postal Service reports net loss of $2 billion for quarter ending June 30, up from net loss of $740 million in the same period 2013; slide comes despite increases in mail prices and growth in shipping services; calls on Congress to help.
lead_paragraph: The net loss for the quarter was up from $740 million in the same period last year, despite increases in mail prices and growth in shipping services.

headline.main: Postal Service Quarterly Loss Was $2 Billion, Despite Higher Prices
headline.print_headline: Postal Service Quarterly Loss Was $2 Billion, Despite Higher Prices
